children.title: Helps promote high cohesion, loosecoupling
creates use case specific view model
limits attributes to what is required
each provide full_name for a model withfirst_name and last_name
does not prevent data leak, but can beused on a presenter that alreadyhandles that issue
The interface segregation principle isabout creating very specialised interfacesfor the client
Helps promote high cohesion, loosecoupling
Cohesion - Degree to which module/classelements belong together
Coupling - Degree to whichmodules/classes depend on each other

Every class should have only
one responsibility.
"Software entities ... should be open forextension, but closed for modification."
"Functions that use pointers or referencesto base classes must be able to use objectsof derived classes without knowing it"
"Many client-specific interfaces are betterthan one general-purpose interface."
repeating code and unused code is common
custom control over what is generated

Model, in modern MVC design pattern, 
is NOT a class or object.

Model is a layer.
Active Record is an enterprise designpattern coined by Martin Fowler andused by Rails

The active record pattern is considered anarchitectural pattern by some people and it isan anti-pattern by others

The interface of an object conforming to thispattern would include functions such as Insert,Update, and Delete, plus properties thatcorrespond more or less directly to thecolumns in the underlying database table.

Rails provides access to it via various DSLmethods including validations andrelationships, cardinality, ordinality andcallbacks
Lot of code is produced by a small team

Classes become dumping ground
for the different logic
Generated vs customised stuff, how to dealwith change (re-generate vs custom)
Fat models to go on a diet
Good test coverage in data tier
Add validation to columns andrelationships
Cleanup scopes, class scopes and developquery objects
Most classes, modules and methods aimto do one things well
Fat controllers go on a diet
